0.Pros: 50% off meal during your lunch only
0.Cons: Management and favoritism customers are rude. Cleaning plugged up toilets full of poop for minimum wage. No one cares about your working environment. Their goal is to just make money and be super fast.

1.Pros: The benefits are actually pretty good.
1.Cons: Hectic schedule, terrible hours, stress, few breaks

2.Pros: The job was decent. Always busy so kept me busy, even though at times it'd be slow I'd keep store clean. Got decent hours one every other week.
2.Cons: Got decent hours and pulled favors for General Manager but they'd give me less hours the following week. Every time I went into work it was a complete mess. Things wouldn't get done unless I ran the shift.

3.Summary: "I work here for more than one year"
3.Pros: McDonald have flexible hour and schedule depend on store location. Most of the employers here is very friendly and willing to help you out.
3.Cons: Shift and the job itself can become a lot stressful depend on customers mood, managers mood, and other factor.

5.Pros: Meet some of the best people you will ever meetChallenging but rewarding workFun atmosphere for the most part
5.Cons: Schedule is all over the placeStressful- not for everyoneLots of rude customersCompensation

6.Pros: Free food, location, schedule, and that's all
6.Cons: Extremely unprofessional , moving up is too much work, horrible pay

7.Pros: Working at night is the most fun with the best management.
7.Cons: Terrible management during the day, never could get any feedback or one on one talk

8.Pros: Free food, great co-workers, learned how to have patience with rude people. It's a great first job for a high schooler.
8.Cons: Rude customers and management, long hours, need more employees to help with cleaning duties at the end of the night.

9.Summary: "Great culture working with bright people in the Corporate Controller Group."
9.Pros: Great group of intelligent and motivated people and plenty of opportunity for advancement throughout the company. Interesting to be a part of such a widely known global organization.
9.Cons: Many times office politics can hinder progress and upper management does not always appropriately listen to feedback from staff.Currently a volatile environment given business results and layoffs.  The financial reporting systems are dated and not user friendly.
